website_summaries.verdict: A large, easy-to-use ice crusher that stays in place and will last you for many years to come.
pros: Stainless steel blades that won't rust
Suction cup base holds the ice crusher securely to the countertop
Simple hand crank operation that doesn't require a lot of force
cons: Some users have said that it is a little difficult to clean properly after use

customer_reviews.title: SUCKS FOR THE WRONG REASONS
customer_reviews.text: SUCKS....WHY? Well, the machine works fine and crushes ice very well BUT...after about 10 days, some black gunk (bacteria) started showing on the steel blades...washed the head in a dishwasher but gunk remained...so I chose to disassemble the crushing mechanism which is just a spindle with sepetators.....except that once they all came appart and went to the washing again.... it became a nightmare to ressemble because it needs to be done INSIDE the head with NO space....I manage once....then had to do it again a few weeks later..and after 20 minutes of anger...I smashed it.
customer_reviews.author: Gil P.

customer_reviews.title: almost three years of use, still going.
customer_reviews.text: Nice manual crusher. easy to clean. large capacity. the suction cup on the bottom is nice when it holds but even without it i have no complaints about this gadget. if it broke today i would order another exactly the same. i highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scottio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for RV
customer_reviews.text: Totally perfect for RV campers. We've used it for a week while camping and it solved a HUGE problem that many campers have: how to make a good mixed drink with the big cubes (actually round barrels) of ice that the portable ice makers produce? Since we only used it a week we can't speak to durability, but this gadget chips those big cubes into the perfect crushed ice while the entire bottom is suctioned solid to the counter top for stability while you crank the handle.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lange

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this crusher heavily over the last two months and I'm loving it so far. For those who aren't fortunate to have a crushed ice option on their fridge, this does the trick. The product so far is deceptively strong. I've only used standard-sized cubes (4 at a time) and while the crusher feels like it might break at times, the plastic and metal crushing apparatus seems to hold up under pressure. As a rule, I crank both ways to even out any resistance from the ice and not ask too much from this product. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: GDM

customer_reviews.title: Built your biceps!
customer_reviews.text: They tell you that there is a suction feature that holds the crusher to your counter - well, it sort of works but you have to put so much elbow-grease into the turning of the handle that sometimes it comes unstuck. This is well made and works fine, but you've really got to have some muscles to get enough torque on that handle to crush your ice. And, it is not quick. I spend several minutes cranking away just to crush 4 or 5 cubes. But if you're not in a hurry and you don't have a plug in - this little bad boy will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Lake Gal

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Hand Crank Ice Crusher
customer_reviews.text: This ice crusher is fantastic. Easy to use and it makes 2 sizes of ice.I was a little afraid that I might have trouble using it as I have very bad arthritis and carpal tunnel syndrome because I broke my wrist and arm. But I can use with no problem. If it gets hard to turn, I just turn the other way and then immediately back and it solves the problem. Easy to wash and can make almost a cup at one time. Bottom container probably holds several cups of crushed ice. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Fochler

customer_reviews.title: like once a year it would last
customer_reviews.text: Works well for a few weeks before it begins to break. The crushing blades are sharp, but the teeth that hold the ice while it is crushed are weak and break! If you only use it occasionally, like once a year it would last, but doesn't holdup in regular usage. This is the second one I have had, thought the first one might have been defective, but i guess the defective thing is the design or the materials used.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Slevc

customer_reviews.title: Just like the one I had as a kid, but now used for grown up drinks
customer_reviews.text: This is a flash to the past. Our fridge doesnt have a crushed ice feature so needed this for mojitos and other summer drinks. Super sturdy and easy to operate. Just like in 1972. 💕
customer_reviews.author: Martial Arts Momma

customer_reviews.title: A different sort of use.
customer_reviews.text: I recently came up with a case of esophageal cancer (no Boo Hoo's please) and a this early stage of my treatment I'm able to keep nothing - even liquids - down. I'm nourished through a feeding tube in my gut. (Fun, fun, fun 'til they took the T-Bone away.) At any rate the only thing I have a shot at is that crushed ice they give you in the hospital, and here it is! Easy to set up, to use and inexpensive on Amazon Prime too! I've also finally discovered a use for cheep booze - just pop it inn the old tube and you'll never taste the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Crushes a Few Cubes Just Fine....
customer_reviews.text: This is an OK ice crusher. Most difficult thing is getting it to stick to the counter. It has not done so yet, at least not for more that a few cranks of the handle. I would have needed to spend $250 to fix my refer ice crusher so this was good option. It is not heavy duty, but does chip ice to a nice texture. The handle is fairly easy to turn until you hit a big chunk our cube. It is a recreational tool at best.
customer_reviews.author: Delbert Fan

customer_reviews.title: Not that stable
customer_reviews.text: You've got to grasp the top of the unit firmly as it does not hold to the counter. The black rubber base does, but not the ice crusher. It take a lot of cranks to get the ice to crush, a lot! It seems that as the blades rotate the ice jumps around on top. I expected to drop a handful of ice in, crank it a few times and have crushed ice....didn't happen.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: perfect to make crushed Ice
customer_reviews.text: the device is excellent to make crushed ice and even if you want to do crushed ice on your blender is best to pre-crush ice in this device and your blender will give to it snow like feel with no problem I'm quite impressed that even if this is plastic this has survived a lot of ice crushing
customer_reviews.author: Techie

customer_reviews.title: Great Ice Crusher
customer_reviews.text: My wife enjoys crushed ice in her cold drinks and we didn’t have an ice crusher. I researched and determined that this was the best buy. She really likes it. She has arthritis in her hands and this unit is easy for her.
customer_reviews.author: Old JW

customer_reviews.title: Love this product, works beautifully....register for warranty just in case of issues or breakage as others have experienced.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this product and it is perfect for what we're looking for. Some are complaining about rusting or breakage, however those same people seem to want to complain rather than take advantage of the 5 year warranty offered by the manufacturer. Great product, though I have registered for the warranty just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality built machine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife after the ice crusher built in to our side by side broke. It does a really nice job of crushing ice. It easily crushes the Half-Moon shaped ice that comes out of the ice maker. It also crushes ice from a regular ice cube tray. It does require a little more effort though. The suction cup base is made from thick rubber and it holds the crusher on the counter. It makes the job of crushing ice a whole lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: S. Vance

customer_reviews.title: Uncomplicated, easy to use, good capacity.
customer_reviews.text: This appliance seems very compact, but holds a very respectable amount of crushed ice. It produces a mix of ice pieces that vary from very fine to what I would call 'chunky'. Takes up very little space. In order to use the device, it *must* be attached to a non-porous flat surface in order to keep it still while cranking, which can get pretty energetic, depending on what size pieces you are crushing.
customer_reviews.author: Waltzing Matilda

customer_reviews.title: Rusts and breaks, but I keep on buying.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite snack is literally chipped ice. This little hand-cranked wonder chops up the frozen water like there's no tomorrow. It's the second one I bought, because everyone has a twin. Nah, actually I bought it again because the first one rusted and broke after a few months. I don't see another one on Amazon with the cool crank action. Kinda sucks knowing it'll rust and fall apart, but I'm willing to shell out a little $$ every few months for one. Not so keen on using an $89 electric crusher. This kind gives my shoulder a great workout!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy70

customer_reviews.title: Works good, requires muscle, overall good product.
customer_reviews.text: Product was a little smaller than it looked or I thought it was. Those have a good suction grip on the countertop. You do have to exert a little bit of muscle to get the ice crushed and it doesn't hold as much as I thought it would. But overall it works great and doesn't take too much time to crush the ice. Wish it was just a little bit finer though but for the price, it's okay
customer_reviews.author: Anne Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, makes good course texture ice for cocktails
customer_reviews.text: Works quite well as long as you don't force it - when it sticks rotate the handle in the other direction. The grain size and texture is good for cocktails - small, course grains - not slush, and not for snow-cones. Its 50-50 if you can get it to stick to the counter top. The big drawback is that it is slow - it takes several minutes to crush enough ice to fill four old-fashioned glasses.
customer_reviews.author: AlchemistGeorge

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work great!?!
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for a month now. It crushed ice, stays sucked to the counter and seems fine. If something changes I’ll update, but i had one before and liked that one too.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Next best thing to automatic ice crushers
customer_reviews.text: I just have to have crushed ice and don't have a refrigerator with one and crushing ice with a mallot got old real fast. This was just what I needed and the price was excellent. Works great and use it all day long as now my grand sons have to have crushed ice with their juice, and love making slushies.Would recommend this to anyone without the luxury of one in their fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Robey

customer_reviews.title: I love my Ice Crusher!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I find that it works really well. I put a few ice cubes in, grind the crank and crushed ice! Would an electrical one be easier? You bet! But I couldn't afford one of those. And this is really easy to work, and it does the job. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: SF Bay Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Little trooper.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the other reviews I expected this to brake in a month or so. I've now had it for 3 months, and have been using it daily. It's still going strong. It takes a little bit of work but it crushes ice like a champ. I can crush a whole tray of ice cubes in less than 5 minutes. It great if you want a cold drink on a hot day but you lack a blinder. It's also great if you have a blinder but you don't like dealing with the handful of ice cubes that it will inevitably miss.
customer_reviews.author: josh ellis

customer_reviews.title: Decent for occasional crushed ice...
customer_reviews.text: Moved into a house with a nice Maytag stainless steel French door refrigerator, but discovered it has no crushed ice capability. So I had to find a solution for those occasional margaritas and mint juleps ;-). This works pretty well without the hassle of cords, but seems a little flimsy and not sure how long it will last before the "teeth" that crush the ice break -- there's a lot of force on these plastic teeth.
customer_reviews.author: G English

customer_reviews.title: will give crushed ice
customer_reviews.text: if you use ice cubes the handle is hard to turn. Need to keep backing handle up and get a "running start" forward to break some ice.
customer_reviews.author: david swanner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition for your at home bar
customer_reviews.text: Love this relatively inexpensive way to have as much crushed ice as you need. Perfect for all kind of cocktails. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki G

customer_reviews.title: Converts large ice "cubes" into more tooth-friendly crushed ice
customer_reviews.text: It's a small thing, but excellent for producing small amounts of crushed ice from too-large ice produced by our refrigerator. Our dog loves the crushed ice as well.
customer_reviews.author: WJBookBoy

customer_reviews.title: It crushes ice relatively well, BUT, getting it ...
customer_reviews.text: It crushes ice relatively well,BUT, getting it suction to to the counter is very frustrating. The lever one uses to pull the rubber base to the counter does not, with any consistency, do its job. I may spend as much time crushing the ice as I do trying to get the rubber base to secure itself to the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super crusher
customer_reviews.text: The suction bottom failed after the first use. Other than that it has worked fine. It helps if you have strong hands. It does work in both directions.
customer_reviews.author: Sire786

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted. . .
customer_reviews.text: Love it!Just what I wanted. I love crushed ice in my drinks but there is not room in my kitchen to put in a refrig that has crushed ice in the door! Finally decided to go looking for one and this one works great. I tend to " chew" ice and with my aging teeth, that can cause real problems. I use it at least daily, sometimes more than one!
customer_reviews.author: Molly  Moo

customer_reviews.title: Gets The Job Done!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to crush ice for margaritas, this baby does a good job of that. It's easy to crank and chops the ice into just the right size. The only issue is the suction holder. It rarely works, so you need to apply pressure to the machine to keep it from sliding around.
customer_reviews.author: Adequate1

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Last 5 Years
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in March 2017 and as you can see from the picture it broke. (Maybe my ice was too frozen;)) I have ordered another one and I have. Hopefully it will last more than 18 months. Sending something back when the sender has to pay shipping is not a very good warranty for something that costs less than $30.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: A Classic With Added Practicable Features
customer_reviews.text: Perfect For Crushing Ice for A Mojito or a Caipirinhia, much better results than its electrical rivals
customer_reviews.author: Unal

customer_reviews.title: It definitely crushes ice!
customer_reviews.text: This is an actual ice crusher not a shaver. I love chewing on ice and the ice comes out perfect size. I was pleasantly surprised at how easy it is to crank. I thought for sure it would be hard to do but it really isn't. I haven't had any trouble using it at all. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Razzle-dazzle

customer_reviews.title: Hit of the party!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this ice crusher for drinks requiring crushed ice. We used it for mint juleps and margaritas.
customer_reviews.author: Majors

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: My niece is 'addicted' to chewing ice and prefers the smaller chips so this was perfect for her! She used it as soon as she could and hasn't stopped since.
customer_reviews.author: marianne bissett

customer_reviews.title: I love crushed ice for a mixed drink or just for ...
customer_reviews.text: I love crushed ice for a mixed drink or just for water and this little gem will tackle all the ice you want to put in the hopper and crank away. The suction base keeps it in place and makes it easy to have crushed ice in just a few seconds. I would highly recommend it to anyone that is a crushed ice junkie like me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes it works great!
customer_reviews.text: just what i was looking for! I wanted one of these for years, glad i purchased it. cranks out 5 cups of crushed ice quickly and efficiently. Two thimbs up!
customer_reviews.author: MJ39

customer_reviews.title: Bought the ice crusher, it broke in 2 months ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the ice crusher, it broke in 2 months. The company replaced it with a new ice crusher. The new one lasted 2 months till it broke. If you want to crush ice a couple of times a week it would be alright, but if you want to use it 4 to 6 times a day it wont stand up to it. All in all it's worth the money, but don't depend on it too much.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Dandy little ice crusher.
customer_reviews.text: It sticks to the cabinet and the crusher works great. It does take a few back and forth motions if it gets jammed. Ice comes out in small pieces, but not too small. About like a fountain drink at the convenience store. Perfect for ice crunchers like me. I just used normal ice cube trays, leaving each one in the freezer until I was ready to crush. No melting that's how fast it works.
customer_reviews.author: shasha0518

customer_reviews.title: This is great, had one 20 years ago and the style ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great, had one 20 years ago and the style hasn't changed....so what does that say? I got another liked it so much!!!
customer_reviews.author: Louiee

customer_reviews.title: very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: love it for crushed ice Seems to be holding up well
customer_reviews.author: chixman48

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and useful:)
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for and needed. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Charles V Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product. The first hopper of ice crushed just like I had wanted it to. The next hopper full was half done when the stupid thing fell apart. And of course there are no instructions for putting it back together and I could not get it back together. I tried everything I could think of and nope. I am just extremely disappointed and upset with the whole thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothea Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Broke after only 2 months of use
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses it to crush ice for herself. After only 2 months of use the plastic in the top lid that holds the ice in place cracked and broke off completed on 1 side. This item is not durable at all for the task it is performing. I would not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Leafty

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Had it for one year so far and still crushing like it is new. They have a fantastic warranty that lasts up to 5 years so you are reassured it's a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok for now
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough but I question it's long term durability
customer_reviews.author: daniel towns

customer_reviews.title: Price was good!
customer_reviews.text: Only problem I had until I recognized that I really had to push and hold the top on firmly was that with multiple cubes being crushed at once, I was the only thing holding the top crusher in place. Crushes quite satisfactorily and replaced an ancient "ice o-mat" from the 1950s-60s. Price was good!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works really well, fast delivery, new and as described. A++!!
customer_reviews.author: ItalianGodzilla

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several of these throughout the years. You just have to be gentle when turning. This one has a sturdy plastic bottom and top. Works perfect everytime.
customer_reviews.author: suckered

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant based on reviews, but its fine so far. I am gentle with it, knowing it is mostly plastic - putting 2-3 ice cubes in at a time. There was once that I could not get it to suction, but could still use it fairly easily. All other times (maybe 5?) have been fine. Makes great crushed ice!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well but too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I originally wanted an electric ice crusher but they are not easy to find. This manual one does the job well but I wonder why the price is as high as it is.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Russo

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does not grind ice like I hoped. More like ice chips and not frozen drink material😬
customer_reviews.author: Firehouse

customer_reviews.title: Good Product.
customer_reviews.text: If you use it too much the plastic will break off and the whole thing needs to be put in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Beans

customer_reviews.title: It's fine
customer_reviews.text: Not super sturdy like the old metal one I had, but it should be fine. The bottom has a suction cup to hold it to the counter, and this works out very well.
customer_reviews.author: Nicky T

customer_reviews.title: Nothing
customer_reviews.text: Will not stay seated on cabinet top while crushing ice.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Shook

customer_reviews.title: This will last about an year of routine use.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I’ve had. My first lasted about an year before the plastic parts on the inside began to break . Hope this lasts longer. 4-5-20: Do not buy this ice crusher! Bought this 2nd on 2-1-20 and already the plastic teeth inside the crusher are all broken. This is junk!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great crusher for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this almost daily for over a month (major ice chewing habit), and it's still the same as when I took it out of the box. I would highly recommend this ice crusher.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t shave it
customer_reviews.text: Worked for me. It chops it like a snow cone or a little bigger. No shave or powder. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: dm

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably priced good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It's pretty sturdy, functions very well, and easy to use. And yes cleaning is a breeze. I expect to have it for a while, and would definitely be ordering a couple as gifts for friends.
customer_reviews.author: Modin

customer_reviews.title: Great gift idea
customer_reviews.text: Sister has kidney problems and is doing dialisys several times a week. Stayed 10 days with us and is not able to have a lot of fluids, but can have ice. The speedy delivery made this a much better option then getting crushed ice by the cup from gas station.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never give a 5 star on anything. BUT, ...
customer_reviews.text: Never give a 5 star on anything. BUT, it did meet my expectations. I would buy another one. I used it a couple of times and it gave me the size ice that I wanted. Time will tell as to how long this will last. Lots of plastic, but the blades are metal so when done, need to make sure they dry properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little machine
customer_reviews.text: Efficient, inexpensive, well built for the price. This makes perfect ice for my cocktails that is right between shaved ice and huge cubes. I don't mind the manual mechanism when I am in need of a drink. On the contrary, it can make just the right amount for a single cocktail or a pair. The process is part of the fun - it's like the anticipation of that perfect blend. I would buy another one of these so I can have 1 upstairs and 1 downstairs!
customer_reviews.author: Michigander

customer_reviews.title: Easy to crush ice and doesn't take alot of effort
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any issues with rusting, but have only used a handful of times. Easy to crush ice and doesn't take alot of effort.
customer_reviews.author: joan sims

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cocktails
customer_reviews.text: Was considering getting a Lewis bag for a while to make crushed ice for cocktails when I learned about manual ice crushers. This works perfectly! On the other hand, decent Lewis bags are expensive and inevitable wear out/get holes in them after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Base Suction Issue
customer_reviews.text: It crushes ice pretty good, with a lot of elbow grease for sure. The problem is the suction base worked great for about a week and now it will not stick at all. If you hold the base down and be careful it still works fine and is much cheaper than an electric machine.
customer_reviews.author: StevieGee

customer_reviews.title: It gets it done
customer_reviews.text: Great little ice crusher. Easy to use and works for my crushed ice needs
customer_reviews.author: Eric C

customer_reviews.title: Next stop, Mojito-ville
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. One cool thing is that it has a suction cup bottom (which is what the strange little handle on the bottom-side does), that is really helpful while cranking this boy.
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: ... a place where you can have metal for a good suction so you can turn the handle for crushed ...
customer_reviews.text: Works ok but it is made for a place where you can have metal for a good suction so you can turn the handle for crushed ice. I would have liked an ice crusher better that attaches to a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Nellie Goddard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My wife was pregnant and we don't have an ice machine in our fridge so this was the next best thing, worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Barga

customer_reviews.title: Cocktails Enhanced
customer_reviews.text: it does what it is supposed to do, like it said it would do....bingo. the consistency of the crushed ice size just makes for a better cocktail that calls for crushed ice. I even purchased one for my friend!
customer_reviews.author: Brian S. Field

customer_reviews.title: Looks good. Crushes ice like its suppose to but you ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks good. Crushes ice like its suppose to but you are the strength behind it. Next time I will spend a little more and get an electric one though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for years and l used it all the time because I loved crushed ice. This ice crusher is so much easier to use because it has a suction cup on the bottom that holds it in place.
customer_reviews.author: jlbl1950

customer_reviews.title: navy68
customer_reviews.text: great device. keep cranking. may hesitate, but this is cubes moving in hopper. like the counter clockwise , nice chunks.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Johnson

customer_reviews.title: tall glass so it's perfect with no waste
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a present for a friend that loves crushed ice in her drinks. She is THRILLED with it! It makes enough crushed ice for a single, tall glass so it's perfect with no waste! Shipping was fast and item was exactly as described. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Hankins

customer_reviews.title: Rusty ice crusher?
customer_reviews.text: This machine does a decent job of crushing cubes into one of two small sizes. But after a few months the crank shaft has started to rust which means that the machine is rapidly becoming useless. It was a stupid design decision to have stainless steel blades with a chrome plated shaft. I intend to return it and try for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Harry F. Lockwood

customer_reviews.title: Hand cranked was hard
customer_reviews.text: It was hard for me to turn handle so I am sending it back
customer_reviews.author: venita

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to get this ice crusher and we used it almost daily in July. Unfortunately, the blades have already started rusting and there is a gray goo that gets on the ice cubes. We don't know where the gray film comes from, it is on the center crank that holds the blades It is most unpleasant. I would not buy this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: My crusher is now four years old and still works light a champ. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: But the crushing itself is quite easy and produces the perfect crushed ice for drinks
customer_reviews.text: Crushes well, quite noisy, and a bit of a pain as you must ensure it is fully dry immediately after use or it will rust. But the crushing itself is quite easy and produces the perfect crushed ice for drinks.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Broke after two months
customer_reviews.text: Liked it for two months. Some teeth just broke off so I guess it’s trash now. Return window closed. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Rob in Orlando

customer_reviews.title: All I wanted is something to take the crushed ice ...
customer_reviews.text: All I wanted is something to take the crushed ice from the ice maker in the refigerator and reduced the bigger pieces to smaller chewable size. This ice crusher doesn't really do anything. .The bigger chunks of ice get stuck in the blades ,jamming the ice crusher.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Lame product.
customer_reviews.text: The suction part doesn't work making it almost impossible to turn crank to shop ice. Would return if my kiddos hadn't tossed the box. Lame product.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalind  T. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great little chipper....
customer_reviews.text: This ice chipper works great and is a good price. I have used it for about 4 months now every night.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Mead

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product. The only problem is the suction on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. The only problem is the suction on the bottom doesn't work. I recently moved to a small place with an ice maker that makes only cubes. I bought this so I would have crushed ice again and it works very well. I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: KATHEEN GARCIA

customer_reviews.title: Real good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I had previously purchased their Johnny Apple Peeler, also an outstanding product. Victorio products are well designed, work well, and are inexpensive. To get the best adherence with the suction apparatus, use the smoothest surface and just a little moisture on the black rubber bottom. I had great crushed ice the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality manual ice crusher
customer_reviews.text: Ice is nicely crushed, base is firmly held down, easy to use. My only regret is that the top isn't more firmly joined with the container. You have to hold the top while turning the crank.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more and get something stronger.
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap construction (although in all fairness it was inexpensive). Jams regularly and by the time you've finished crushing 4 ice cubes they've already started to melt.
customer_reviews.author: CT Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Exactly what I was looking for. Stays on the counter. Easy and crushes the ice just the way I like. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Hard to crank
customer_reviews.text: We returned the ice crusher since it was too hard for my wife to use and crushed ice cubes too small.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Batchelder

customer_reviews.title: Shaft rusts
customer_reviews.text: Works great until shaft rusts internally and gets black liquid all over the ice. Victorio knows the problem but won't make everything stainless.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not very effective. Wont crush large ice cubes very well. Rate of crushed ice is slow. Probably re-gift it.
customer_reviews.author: bulldawg

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Ice Crusher
customer_reviews.text: This little manual ice crusher machine will crush 2 ice trays in 3-4 minutes. My wie and I enjoy just munching on crushed ice as well as a few mixed drinks during the hot weather. It's well constructed, vise holds firm to the kitchen counter and it's truly portable. No electric cord, batteries to buy. Just a nice buy.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: itworks well enough.
customer_reviews.text: it is cheaply made but did a good enough job while I waited to get my ice maker replaced
customer_reviews.author: Tara Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one day
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a hand operated ice crusher and this was the only one I could find. It broke the second time I used it! Very poor quality. I had to order a motor driven one that is working out well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Morrine

customer_reviews.title: I need a replacement part!
customer_reviews.text: I need a replacement part and cant get the 800 number to work. I wouldn't think it should break in such a short time. Its not used every day but have only had it 4 mo.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Ann Nichopoulos

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for. No rust so ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. No rust so far (about 2 months in, and I use it almost daily). I just rinse it and let it air dry with the lid open.
customer_reviews.author: C. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Design for the ages.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. It is an example of "don't mess up a good thing." My parents got an ice crusher with a very similar design in 1936! This one has been streamlined a bit but is essentially the same thing. It does what it is supposed to do - crush ice.
customer_reviews.author: Denny P

customer_reviews.title: A Julep isn't a Julep without Crushed Ice
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with the ice crusher. Two settings - course and fine aren't that much different. The fine setting is what I wanted - from ice tray ice cubes to pea sized crushed ice in the time it takes to say, "yeah, I'll have a tall one." Crushed ice makes even ice water colder and more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nunn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in this item
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this since I received it in Feb. It has started splattering gray on the counter it is coming from where the crank is inside the unit plus some of the metal parts are rusting.
customer_reviews.author: Trill

product_meta.title: Portable Hand Crank Ice Crusher by VICTORIO
product_meta.description: Quickly and easily prepare coarse or finely crushed ice for your favorite beverage with the VICTORIO VKP1126 Hand Crank Ice Crusher. Compact size of 9-1/2 inches x 4-1/2 inches x 6 inches makes it easy to store and use.
feature_bullets: Quickly produce crushed ice for any kind of drink by simply turning the chrome plated steel handle
Great for kitchen use, wet bars, parties, and entertaining
Sturdy suction base keeps ice crusher in place on smooth, nonporous surfaces

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars894 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
